Name: β Cru
Notes:
Mimosa, Becrux; 20th brightest star; β Cep variable, *V*max = +1.23m, *V*min 
= +1.31m, *P* = 0.2365072 d Probable high-mass member of Lower Centaurus 
Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association.[1]

Name: α1 Cru (α Cru A)
Notes:
Acrux, 23rd brightest star, multiple star, spectroscopic binary. Possible 
member Lower Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association 
(debated).[1]

Name: α2 Cru (α Cru B)
Notes:
component of the α Cru system. Possible member Lower Centaurus Crux 
subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association (debated).[1]

Name: δ Cru
Notes:
β Cep variable; *V*max = +2.78m, *V*min = +2.80m, *P* = 0.151038 d
Member of the Lower Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus 
Association.[2]

Name: μ1 Cru
Notes:
binary star; suspected variable; Member of the Lower Centaurus Crux 
subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association.[2]

Name: ζ Cru
Notes:
double star, Member of the Lower Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus 
Association.[2]

Name: HD 110956
Notes:
double star; suspected slow irregular variable; Member of the Lower 
Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association.[2]

Name: λ Cru
Notes:
β Cep variable, Δ*V* = 0.02m, *P* = 0.3951 d, Member of the Lower Centaurus 
Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus Association.[2]

Name: θ2 Cru
Notes:
spectroscopic binary; β Cep variable, *V*max = +4.70m, *V*min = +4.74m, *P* 
= 0.0889 d

Name: α Cru C
Notes: probable optical double with the α Cru system; suspected variable

Name: μ2 Cru
Notes: component of μ Cru system; γ Cas variable, *V*max = +4.99m, *V*min = +5.18m

Name: HD 110432
Notes: high-mass X-ray binary; γ Cas variable, *V*max = +5.24m, *V*min = +5.45m

Name: HD 112244
Notes: emission-line star; variable star, Δ*V* = 0.008m, *P* = 2.00288 d

Name: κ Cru
Notes:
member of the Jewel Box star cluster (note that κ Cru usually refers to the 
cluster itself); variable star, Δ*V* = 0.014m, *P* = 9.53562 d

Name: HD 110506
Notes:
Member of the Lower Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus 
Association.[2]

Name: HD 110461
Notes:
Member of the Lower Centaurus Crux subgroup of the Scorpius–Centaurus 
Association.[2]

Name: γ Cru B
Notes: component of the γ Cru system
